structures.title: Sequencing: No. 1 to 3 (3 minutes)
structures.text:
In this part, you will see a list of sentences in random order.  Arrange them into a good conversation between Linda and Kenny. 

Type the letter (A/B/C/…) in the box.

A part of the conversation has been done for you.

structures.title: Information Transfer: No. 4 and 5 (2 minutes)
structures.text:
In this part, you will see a blind map and a piece of story about Jillian.

Read the text carefully and locate 2 buildings on the map. The name of the building is underlined.

Type the letter (A/B/C/…) in the box.

structures.title: True/False/Not Stated: No. 6 to 10 (5 minutes)
structures.text:
In this part, you will see a passage from an article entitled “Why It Is Important To Have A Supportive Network Of Family And Friends”.

Read the passage carefully and decide if the statements are:

-True (supported by the text)

-False (contrary to the text) or

-Not stated (no information in the text)

Type your answer in the box.

structures.title: Gap-fill: No. 11 to 15
structures.text:
In this part, you will see a transcript of audio about pollution, with blanks.

You will have some time to look at questions 11 to 15.

Then, listen to the recording carefully to find out the missing words.

The recording will be played ONCE only. ANSWER AS YOU LISTEN.

  

Type your answer in the box.

structures.title: Information Transfer: No. 16 and 20
structures.text:
In this part, you will see the data of a cinema ticket reservation with missing information. You will have some time to look at questions 16 to 20.

Then, listen to the recording carefully to find it out.

The recording will be played ONCE only. ANSWER AS YOU LISTEN.

 

Type your answer in the box.

structures.title: Short Answer: No. 21 and 25
structures.text:
In this part, you will see a list of questions based on audio about Graham and Barbara on a flight.

You will have some time to look at questions 21 to 25.

Then, listen to the recording carefully and answer questions 21 to 25.

Write the answer in NO MORE THAN 4 WORDS.

The recording will be played ONCE only. ANSWER AS YOU LISTEN.

 

Type your answer in the box.

structures.title: Sentence Building: No. 26 and 27
structures.text:
In this part, you will arrange 2 jumbled sentences into correct sentences related to technology.

Type your answer in the box.

structures.title: Sentence Building: No. 28 and 29
structures.text:
In this part, you will use the given isolated words to write 2 sentences related to technology.

Type your answer in the box.

structures.title: Sentence Building: No. 30
structures.text:
In this part, you will write a sentence related to ‘technology’ based on the picture.

Type your answer in the box.

structures.title: Transformation: No. 31 and 32
structures.text:
In this part, you will see 2 sentences related to science, with blanks. Transform the word in brackets into its appropriate form.

Type your answer in the box.

structures.title: Transformation: No. 33
structures.text:
In this part, you will see a full-sentence related to climate change. Re-write the sentence by using the words provided, but keep the meaning equivalent.

Type your answer in the box.

structures.title: Transformation: No. 34 and 35
structures.text:
In this part, you will combine simple sentences by using appropriate linking words: for/and/nor/but/or/yet/so.

Type your answer in the box.

structures.title: Guided Writing
structures.text:
In this part, you will fill in a member application form to join a sports club.

Type your answer in the box.

structures.title: Guided Writing
